question: Seroconversion rate is how much after 3 doses of Hepatitis B vaccine?
exp: -Seroconversion rates exceed 95% after 3 doses of Hepatitis B vaccine. - Antibody titre > 10m. IU/ml is protective - This Vaccine usually induces long-term immunity- so, booster doses are not routinely recommended - Double dose of vaccine/ boosters - recommended in pts with chronic kidney disease / immunodeficiency - in whom titers may wane

question: Active immunity is not acquired by which of the following?
exp: - Immunoglobulins - provide passive immunity Active immunity: - Protective response mounted by a person's own immune system after clinical / subclinical infection / vaccination. - Comprises humoral / cellular immune responses Passive immunity: - Ready-made protection against disease provided by introduction of preformed animal/ human antibodies into the human body Passage of IgG from mother to fetus through placenta Transmission of secretory IgA in breast milk Administration of Antisera

question: Antisera is obtained from:
exp: ANTISERA: -Antisera are usually prepared in horses -provide passive immunization - Immunoglobulin fraction is concentrated using ammonia sulfate & some products are fuher treated with some enzymes to decrease reactions to foreign proteins. -Antisera are used against diseases like Diphtheria, Tetanus, Rabies.
